How to Install nodm on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • nodm

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install nodm on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing nodm on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall nodm in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install nodm, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install nodm Using apt

To install nodm in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install nodm using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install nodm

The installation of nodm might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install nodm Using apt-get

To install nodm using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install nodm.

sudo apt-get -y install nodm

Install nodm Using Synaptic

To install nodm using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install nodm on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for nodm. This will display the nodm package in the package window, now to install nodm, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the nodm package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of nodm.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install nodm Using aptitude

To install nodm on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of nodm.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install nodm using the command aptitude install nodm.

sudo aptitude -y install nodm

How to Upgrade nodm on debian

If you want to upgrade the nodm package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade nodm using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade nodm to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade nodm.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade nodm sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade nodm

Upgrade nodm using Aptitude

To upgrade nodm using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade nodm.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade nodm

Upgrade nodm using Synaptic

To upgrade nodm using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for nodm, now right-click nodm, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade nodm just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall nodm on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall nodm from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just nodm, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove nodm

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of nodm

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of nodm you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge nodm

Remove nodm using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall nodm using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for nodm, right-click the nodm package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall nodm click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install nodm on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade nodm using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
